title: Patient-Reported Outcomes in Older Adults With Transthyretin Amyloid Cardiomyopathy - JACC

summary.text: The study highlights the importance of patient-reported outcomes in assessing quality of life for older adults with transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy (ATTR-CM), emphasizing the need for tailored management strategies that prioritize functional capacity and symptom burden.

Operational insights suggest integrating comprehensive geriatric assessments into clinical practice to better understand the unique challenges faced by older patients with ATTR-CM, potentially leading to more personalized treatment plans.

The research underscores the value of multidisciplinary care teams in managing ATTR-CM in the elderly, advocating for collaborative efforts between cardiologists, geriatricians, and other specialists to optimize patient outcomes and enhance adherence to therapy.
